Specific Details: To Secure funding to achieve Purple Flag Status in Maynooth
DPOs Lobbied: Sonya Kavanagh|Director of Services or Equivalent|Kildare County Council::Naoise O'Cearúil|Councillor|Kildare County Council
Subject Matter: To Secure funding to achieve Purple Flag Status in Maynooth
Intended Results: To win Purple Flag Status in Maynooth through a joint project with Kildare Co Co
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Allan Shine CEO North Kildare Chamber
Grassroots directive: Support of the project - this will commence in Feb 2016

DPOs Lobbied: Sonya Kavanagh|Director of Services or Equivalent|Kildare County Council::Peter Carey|CEO|Kildare County Council::Naoise O'Cearúil|Councillor|Kildare County Council
Intended Results: To seek Purple Flag status for Maynooth.  Purple Flag is  an  international  accreditation  programme for  town  and  city centres in  the early  evening and night time economy.  It is the “gold standard” for night time destinations.  Like  Blue  Flag  for  beaches,  places  that  meet  the standards  can  fly  the  flag.    Over  65  town  and  city  centres  have  been awarded  Purple  Flags  since  the  scheme  was  launched  by  ATCM  in October 2009; the first places in the Re

DPOs Lobbied: Tim Durkan|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Darragh Fitzpatrick|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Naoise O'Cearúil|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Brendan Weld|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Paul Ward|Councillor|Kildare County Council
Intended Results: Avoidance of over-zoning for residential lands within the Clane Local Area Plan. i.e. more than required to achieve the 780 units target set in the original draft Clane LAP 2017-2023 and the core strategy of the County Development Plan 2017-2023.::Avoid reduction of buffer zone for parkland along the Liffey from 100m (as per original draft Clane Local Area Plan) to 80m (as per Proposed Material Alteration 41).
Lobbying Activities: Summary email (title 'Clane LAP - Wednesday May 10th') and copy of our submission on draft Clane LAP emailed to selection of local Councillors.|Email|2-5::Attempted to phone selection of local Councillors. Note none of the five we phoned answered, or returned our call.|Phone call|2-5

Specific Details: The upgrading of our local Health Centre. The people of Maynooth would like a KDOC 24/7 medical service. We are looking for funding to rejuvinate our playground in the Harbour Field. We have a massive young population and we need to drive to a park and playground. If we rejuvinate our current one it promotes a better healthier lifestyle by leaving the car at home.
Subject Matter: The upgrading of our local Health Centre. The people of Maynooth would like a KDOC 24/7 medical service. We are looking for funding to rejuvinate our playground in the Harbour Field. We have a massive young population and we need to drive to a park and playground. If we rejuvinate our current one it promotes a better healthier lifestyle by leaving the car at home.
Intended Results: We will write a letter to the Minister of Health and meet with the local TDS that represent North Kildare. CCLR Naoise O Cearuil will write to the public parks expenditure body and put forward a case of behalf of the people.
Lobbying Activities: We met Naoise in the Lobby of the Glenroyal Hotel on Monday the 21st at 10am. We discussed a range of public issues with him to which he responded via e-mail with the work he will carry out.|Email|2-5

Specific Details: Commercial Rates charges applied by the county council on the basis of valuations issued by the valuations office.
DPOs Lobbied: Angela Feeney|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Naoise O'Cearúil|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Peter Hamilton|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Tim Durkan|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Brendan Weld|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Paul Ward|Councillor|Kildare County Council::Daragh Fitzpatrick|Councillor|Kildare County Council
Subject Matter: Commercial Rates charges applied by the county council on the basis of valuations issued by the valuations office.
Intended Results: To garner support from local officials for an appeal for an exemption on the rates valuation applied by the valuations office.
Lobbying Activities: The lobbying related to operations at Maynooth Students' Union (MSU) Club, on the campus of Maynootsh University. The subject was solely related to commercial rates applicable to the club operations and the purpose was to set out reasoning for which the MSU Club may be considered for an exemption on commercial rates and support from official representatives in bring an appeal for such an exemption.|Email|6-10
